comments.text: Kind of place where you can be a bit demanding on the destination. After 20 min i refuse 3 cars for overkalix and morjarv . After 30... Finally someone that was going to Kiruna ! I couldn't hope for more. You can also durectly ask at the gasstation but and find a car event faster, but for long distance like this i prefer someone that's really choose to take me.
Great spot picked up a ride in less than 5 min all the way to kiruna
Car density is pretty low, but even though we got a ride in just half an hour, but we were lucky. I can imagine, that we could spent here a lot of time.

(Winter) Direction South. Good spot even in Winter at night, got a ride to Piteå in about an hour, there is the petrol station and a restaurant where you may ask people but our ride came out of the road.
Hitched here in summer 2010, waited around 5 min in daylight, with a sign GVE, got a straight ride to GÃ¤llivare.
Ride to lovanger, about 30min. Good spot.
It's a good spot indeed, but it's still has some local traffic so we waited a while.

Summer/ Dir South

ALOT of room for cars and even trucks to stop!
Bus stop. There crossing with traffic lights right just before. Cars are going slow and density is high.

Perfect spot to go south. You can probably find someone who takes you very far, so maybe don't take the first person who only goes 30 kilometers to Nyköping (because it is very hard to get away from there).
Tumbed at the exit
Got a ride to Malmö in 20 min, lots of cars to ask.
Big rest area with a petrol station, toilets, and options to camp. Good for getting a ride to Malmö or Denmark. At the petrol station you can charge your phone and sit.

August, Southbound, 10AM
First car offered me a ride to Malmö, second car took me to Copenhagen.
There is a really nice camping spot 30 minutes from here. Walk across the bridge, and hop the fence at the gasstation on the other side of the highway. There is a little trail that you can follow for +-20 minutes, which brings you to a little forest near some houses, right next to lake Råsjö. Awesome
The first people we asked took us to malmö. A very good spot
Highly recommending this spot. Everyone goes towards Stockholm from this roundabout and there’s easily time and room to stop your car. It’s 9 o’clock so there’s lots of work traffic.

All traffic going straight on the roundabout is literally going towards Stockholm. Waited 7 minutes for a ride, while traffic Saturday morning in Januari. Close to busstop "Uppsala Business Park", easy to park a bike there and Swebus (Stockholm - Uppsala for 59 SEK) stops there.
Really good spot. Don't accept a ride shorter then Örnsköldsvik. All the spots between these 2 are REALLY bad. But this spot is awesome so much traffic.
Awesome spot. Separate line for buses, good visibility, there is also a fast food, where lot of lorry drivers stop, so you can try one of them.
Maybe I just got lucky, but I got a ride to Helsingborg almost immediately. I slept in the nearby field.

I was walking toward the on ramp in Helsinborg direction and waving at cars and to my surprise, one of them actually stopped. Also, there is a comfortable field by trees nearby for sleeping if arrive late to this place.
Very nice spot with plenty of place for a car to stop
We wanted to go to Goteborg, but we caught a ride to Halmstad instead, wron where I believe it will be much easier to go to GTB :)

Little space to pull over except a crappy bit of grass, but it worked! Hitching direct from the on ramp, ride in 15 mins north to Gothenburg. Boom. What was that about Sweden being crap for hitchhiking?
An excellent spot if you go to Malmo. Cars go slow and someone will pick you very soon.
I was hoping to get to Karlstad, but the very first car stopped and offered to get me halfway. Good spot
Many cars heading towards Karlstad.
Huge rest area with a shop and restaurant. There is also a parking lot for trucks.
Got a ride to Abisco, rain and big backpack helped :)
Got a ride to Abisco, rain and big backpack helped :)
Car are a bit fast, but very good traffic and HUGE place to pull over. So perfect spot to go to upsala.
Good classic spot
Probably you could catch a long ride from this perfect spot. But after 10min i just took a ride to the end of the city to continue south.
TONs of traffic w/ Norwegians going to the city after harryhandel. Raining hard and some lady took pity on me and picked me up near-instantly, but I don’t expect it would take long otherwise

One male 40+, one big and one small backpacks, a rainy (drizzle) day. Going to Stockholm.
A very good spot. An exit from lorry stop (some custom place) good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. Not very busy road, a few cars per minut.
I didn't wait at all. I just stopped and I was about to take the sign out from my backpack, whe first lorry leaving the custom car park stopped and took me all the way to Stockholm. The fact that I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem
Best hhing spot north from Sundsvall!
Got chased on my walk to the road by a guy who took me here on my way to Umeå, much easier to get rides here than in Sweden I think
Guys from my last ride just went and asked a truckie if I could ride with him lol, was pretty wicked. Got all the way to Östersund

Bus stop to hitchhack to Lysekil and see the pink rocks even if they are more beautifull in Bretagne 😉
Did not wait long
I think we were just very very lucky, just as we started stoping some lady pick us up and take us stright to our destination :)
The best spot in Sundsvall for the E4 south. Large space to stop on the onramp with all the traffic from the E14

Gas station and rest area – a perfect spot for both northbound and southbound directions! Many cars heading to Oslo and Gothenburg, and one was even going all the way back to Serbia. Ask people at the gas station and in the charging area. I got a ride to Oslo.
Perfect spot, close to a rest area and a gas station. I got a short ride to Uddevalla.

Sunday morning, solo female, sign for E4/north, on the entrance to the gas station. Not many people stop for gas, but all the cars that go through the road can stop. Got a ride inmediately, Belgian campervan, to Sundsvall.
Slow speed, good visibility, parking spots behind enable safe stopping - although the truck that picked me up didn't care about these.
Waited for drivers leaving the parking area of the supermarket. They're almost all going down to Norway (hh in August 2025)

Caught a ride to Mora from here, there is a petrol station which is quite busy and even standing by the road with s sign works. Many people going to Mora  or further north. I caught a ride with a German van. Much love and good luck hitching🌻
Asked the truck drivers at the diesel station for the trucks.
A woman picked us up to Malmö
A guy picked us on his way back home from IKEA

We were about to give up and go to eat McDonalds 40 minutes away on foot, but a really nice girl saw us being in misery,  approached us and asked if we need a ride. We wanted to reach Oslo, she drove us a little bit over Undelvalla :) (couple)

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!

Hi! I'm a Swedish journalist working on a piece about hitchhiking. Are you currently (or have recently) hitchhiked through western Sweden? Then I want to interview you! Send med an email on klara.larsson@bohuslaningen.se . Happy travels!
We wanted to go to Goteborg to start catching a ride to Oslo, it was raining but we managed to hop in quickly with backpacks (couple)
really quick, the guy had seen us run after the bus and was already planning on offering a ride
Summer 2025, 18:20, a friendly woman from Germany stoped
Summer 2025, 17:40, very friendly people in the villages
Summer 2025, 9:30 a.m. , very friendly people.  Even 2 cars stopped in the first 13 min
A very good spot for going to Lund. I got ride in 10min with Lund sign. It is a small bus stop and there is enough space for cars to stop.
3 cars stopped in a short time, maybe everybody was heading home after work, a nice swedish man picked me up because he tried to hitchhike when he was young( though failed)..
Best place to be. Church member from Stockholm who visited Örebro and was willing to take me back.

Easily visible, wide exit of the roundajout. Cars can stop while other traffik can still pass by. Also very clear which direvtion you want to go to by standing next to the sign. Seems like a very promising spot. Guy lived countryside and used to hitchhike to school during his youth, took me to my final destination direction, stunning honestly.

Insanely lucky, asked around at the gas station for a ride to Avesta, tested my luck at a busstop. First truck driver pulled over, drove me to the highway intersection with lots of traffik towards Västerås and Avesta. Although this (bus)stop isn't great for Avesta, I think it's quite promising with traffik going from Uppsala to other destinations.

Asked around at the gasstation first, but realised the busstop was perfect considering the huge amount of traffik. Made a sign with '70' to make sure any traffik going right on the roundabout would just ignore me. Guy going to play golf near Sala thought hitchhikers were cool and offered me a ride. Was already quite tired, so loved to just have someone to talk to while slowly creeping towards my destination near Avesta.
Wide shoulder for going towards Västeras, lots of traffic, got a ride within 20 minutes, speeds are slow

First major service station in north, but I still decided to just hitchhike at entrance and it worked very well, just about the right amount of traffic and cars go very slow, good shoulder for them to stop, possibility to get real long rides towards south, wait time of 10 minutes, and almost every car reacted friendly that didn't pick up

Great spot, both by the road as well as asking around in this parking lot, lots of trucks and mainly getting fuel or food, got a ride offer to Finland within 10 minutes and within 40 minutes got truck going a long distance to south, probably best spot for long distance rides anywhere around here
Amazing spot for going southbound, very wide shoulder that is asphalted, speeds are slow and decent visibility, lots of cars from here go the least to Pitea, wait time of 5 minutes
Perfect if going south. There is a perfect bus stop for cars to stop but it doesn't appear on the map. Got a ride very quickly.

Got a lift to Karesuando by 10 mins.
I was lucky. Low traffic
A large petrol station and also a supermarket parking. Many people driving long distance.
Missed a train and walked here, despite having luggage, got a car immediately, but not that much of traffic, wait time of 5 minutes
Got a ride to Sundsvall in about 20 min using a sign. Friday evening. Safe spot, good visibility.
Space to stop and lot of traffics
Good traffics, not so much place to stop. Get a ride to Kalix
Great place, much place to pull over and great visibility. It is in the city so cars go slow but nearly everybody stays on the highway.
We talked to people at the electric vehicle charging station, and directly found a nice couple who took us very far south.
Bus stop with ok visibility/speed and place to pull over. Ride to Falkenberg. English speaking driver.

Great spot for evening ride since the traffic is not that heavy at that time. A bit stopover place. the spot is the resemble of highway and torp city road. definitely the best place if you are desperate at night
Bus stop, good visibility and plenty space. Going south
Plenty place for cars to park
Nice spot where cars are moving slowly due to the camera on the road and enough space for them to safely stop
Very good spot, lot of passage going to Malmö. Go under the bridge there is a spot for cars to stop.

Totally agree with Chris about that bus stops near highways are better than gas station in Sweden.
This gas station worked well for me, got a ride north to Halmstad. I was hitchhiking at the entrance of the gas station.

got a 45 mins walk and found this spot looking at my MapsMe map. During 20 minutes 2 cars stopped - the 1st one was going to Linkoping, the next one to Angelholm, my direction south.
The spot is alright, possible to stay there, enough space to pull over, but some cars are going fast, but still alright in my opinion.

A perfect place BUT not much traffic even I got a short ride with the local kids to Kungalv.
At this spot there is a good place for camping if you got stuck on the night.
Seemed like a bad spot with only a little hard shoulder, but people did pullover, traffic slow, solid visibility. Onwards north. English driver. Yay!

Walking along the residential road, small hard shoulder and a little slow traffic, the 1st car stopped and took me all the way to malmo! Driver was nice and spoke perfect English. 7am in morning. Solo male.

Easy free ride out of ume, hitching from ume is waste of time and this option is recommended. Get on any train that goes to hörnefors which is next stop south after umeå östra. Go to the other side of the train from staff and they will not have time to check ur ticket. (If they would, just get off at hörnefors anyways, they might get mad but won't do anything.
Busy rest area at the arctic circle.
A lot of space to stop, good traffic. Didn't take long to get a ride. Calm and beatiful places to sleep

Oh damn was I lucky! I was going with a sign to Karlstad along the road and a van instantly stopped by. Took me almost directly to Stockholm! The place is overall pretty nice, a lot of space to pull over for the whole road + a bus stop. You will definitely get a ride here

Towards Finland. 
Speed limit is 110 but you are visable from a good distance. There's a bus stop, so place to stop for drivers and shelter for you. More traffic than the onramp near the town

We went to south with sign Göteborg. There is some place behind the roundabound. If you go opposite way, There is near another roundabound where it is possible, too.
Many people go home to Village around, so it is not easy to find someone going further. But better to get to some Gas station than nothing. 😊

Popular hotel and view point. A lot of cars going both north and south stop there to enjoy the view or get a snack. I spent the night camping near the water and got a ride in the morning from the very first car passing me.
Gas station, plenty of traffic. After 45 mins of asking around got a ride to Lulea.
Parking, lot of tourist going south, lot of van and CAMPERVAN, few trucs. Very easy to have a long distance ride, if you go early even maybe all the way to Stokholm.

Summer 2023. Ask to the people After they took gas. The second car accept ! 
They all go at least to Tore. Probably eazy to go until Kiruna. Lot of norvegian car if you want to increase your chance of long distance :)
First person i asked took us (2 people) to the city center in göteborg. As well there is a toilette on the resting place.

intersection of 2 roads, kinda in the middle of nowhere, but after 10 mins a car going to Oslo stopped.
At this spot the cars turn from E10 to E45.
I was standing right at the entrance where cars have to stop and give way. It's not the best place, but there's no better in the area heading north.

For Sweden this is a very good spot. Lots of truck drivers that you can ask directly. They are usually very friendly and I shared coffee with them.
Got a long distance ride almost all the way to Stockholm! Just be patient as there might be times with barely any traffic - have a snack and wait for the trucks

If you want to ride a really long distance in a short time, the eastern highway is ideal. Many cars and trucks go as far as the Stockholm area or further. With one driver you are able to drive almost the whole of Sweden.
Nice place to hitchhike into Gøteborg. Got a ride after 10 minutes! (I had a GØ sign with me)

I got an instant ride on the ferry. 

I'm just flexing, I didn't get to know the spot.
Easy to get a lift at least onto the ferry (running almost non stop) to Denmark. Then  you can continue on the other side. Or aks around on the ferry.
Stood somewhere around here with a sign saying "DK", got a lift over the ferry within 15 min. From Helsingør it's very easy to get to Copenhagen.

Ask for a bus to Ikea to reach close to here (bus stop: Stångjärnsgatan). Felt like the cars are too fast but in the other hand the curb on the side is wide and we got a ride in 15 minutes. We were on the verge of moving to the beginning of the previous roundabout where I think I saw a busstop. Will happily leave an analysis of that spot for another time. :)
Asked trucks before entering the ferry. Most trucks are afraid they’re gonna get in trouble by taking you over the border so try not to be suspicious looking. Was there around 5 pm
On the ferry you can ask people in the cars, got at once a ride to rodby. Many people (swedens) go to germany to buy as much beer as there is any space in their cars!
Got a ride near Halmstad, giant space for cars to stop, good visibility, cars a little bit fast but not too much.
Night time hitch to Lund, very good spot.
Had quite a bit of luck, but the spot itself doesn’t seem ideal. Cars to quite fast
would take like 10 minutes if we agreed to go with the first car. we decided to wait a little to get a little bit further. i recommend this spot as well as the mulberry tree
Not so busy gas station. We definitely ran into Swedish coldness a bit here but got ride from Swed in the end who also gave us some bulle :))
Had two cars offer me rides, took the second one after 20 min wait time and went to the viewpoint of höga kusten bron

to sundsvall.
People where very friendly.
Gas station directly on the highway (a rarity in Sweden). Mostly people going to Uppsala or the aiport, but some are going more north, so good luck.
Waited about 10 mins at the exit from the drivethru / gas stop. Got a lift to Gävle.
Asked people filling their tanks here in October 2013, got a lift with the second guy I asked to Gävle.

Lot of truck drivers. Good for goteborg, helsingborg, trelleborg, ystad or other cities in sweden. Just ask around lot of polish and ukrainian drivers.

Keep in mind that lot of drivers is waiting for the papers, it can take 10,20 minutes or 5 hour or like mine drive who took me 4 days but happy for me i was waiting around an hour
Good spot to hitch a ride with a truck. I got dropped off here so idk how else to reach this place but definitely a good spot to be dropped off.

Many many truck drivers stopping here for customs. Possible to get a lift long distances (even Germany, Eastern europe). But beware as drivers are told by the customs office they are only alloud one passenger. Groups will have to split.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Thursday evening. This spot is "play with fire" style : looks dangerous enough for cars to stop and help you, but is not so dangerous as there is an emergency lane for cars to stop. Not ideal in my opinion, but it got us a car to Landskrona.
great spot, you can find long distance driver here easily

towards Gothenburg.I walked here from the central station Lund,in fifteenminutes.Compared to the roundabout down the road,this place's just great.if using sign then mark "E6 N".Few mintues wait and voila,you are on the momve again;)
Instead of taking an expensive taxi / bus, we just asked our neighbor if he wad going to the city center by car. And he did! That was a quick free ride!

We got super lucky, tried to catch a ride to Malmö at 8 am on a Saturday and we succeeded after about 10 minutes. It's a difficult spot to hitchhike from, there aren't many cars going as there's also not many flights on the airport. Nevertheless, we managed to get a ride from a Polish couple picking up a friend from the airport.
Tried to get a ride to Copenhagen - waited for two hours and got only to Malmo.
We spent about 5 minutes in the evening. Near the gas station. Good spot for cars to stop.

A friend and I tried to hitch a ride here for like 50 minutes, but had to stop and catch a bus to make it on time :( Probably an ok spot, but no great place for cars to stop, and file for E4 South is not on the side of the road where one stands. Would wager a guess it's better when there's less traffic, so people feel more ok to stop?
Looks like a place without possibility to pull over the road, but I was waiting there for only 20 minutes.  I got lift from a truck driver who stopped on the roundabout
Late July 2014. Great place to hitch. Lots of cars heading south. Bad place for cars to pull over but me and a friend got a ride to Jönköping in 20 min.
Just before the roundabout, most cars passing by are heading south, taking the slip road onto E4.

Good spot where people can easily see you and stop. Traffic goes a little fast though. The actual spot is just a little further than indicated here, it's a proper parking zone big enough for people to have time to brake.

Big parking spot next to the road.
Got a lift directly to Luleå.
Easy ride to Stockholm, lots of traffic around noon

In the night before we stayed in the forest near the train tracks, but somehow it smelled a lot like rotten camembert cheese, so avoid staying there overnight. But the gas station was good, we were picked up quickly.

It's a great place to hitchhike.  We stood there for maybe 10 minutes and someone stopped and dropped us off at Hörby. This is probably the best place to hitchhike in Lund if you need to go somewhere on the highway. I definitely recommend it.
actually good and pretty safe.
Quite ok. Not perfect but the car can be slow in the front of the bus stop.
Good place by the buss station, right before a traffic light so the cars don't go so fast
Summer 2025, 16:20, a turkish guy picked me up, the Swedish people here a very closed
Not so common to see hithickers. Some people looked at me like an E T. But find a ride to Lulea
Originally tried further up the main road at a bus stop and waited for one hour before relocating to this roundabout and getting a ride within 7 minutes

Trying to go North. There is a bus stop, definitly a good place to go on the 172.
Fargelanda
I was probably lucky but a nice place with a lower speed limit, so people can see you in advance and still the cars driving out of the gas station won’t miss you.
Gas station i get a ride just by hitchiking people on the main road. 80kmh. But they see you from far.

I rate it 5 stars, but the police that sent me away probably give it 0.
Definitely not unsafe as they suggested. But I obeyed and moved to the bus stop at the  gas station. Crossing the roundabout was probably more dangerous than staying at the exit though...

So just make the most of it until the police come.
Instant ride with finish people in a van, going all the way to sundsvall !

Superb spot, got picked up immediately, very nice bus stop with slow speeds, wide enough for lorries to stop, you may get super lucky here, if you wish to get a long distance drive i'd recommend having a sign and waiting and not accepting the shorter ones, but superb spot, wait time of under a minute
Quick and perfect spot for E4. Cars can stop easily to the bus stop

I literally got picked up the minute I stuck out my thumb. Ride all the way to Sundsvall! Got so lucky, but also a good spot I guess. Bus stop at the E4, enough place to stop for the car and they still drive quite slowly after the roundabout.

After the IKEA I had to wait a bit but I got picked up after an hpur or so 
BUT BEWARE SWEDEN IS TERRIBLE FOR HITCHHIKING !!! :D
Not very safe nor good for cars to stop but large amounts of traffic, I got a ride to luleå very quickly
Pretty good spot even though it is not super easy for cars to stop  Got a ride in winter on 30min towards Skillifteå.
Early morning. First car stopped and took me to Skelleftea.
They are two lanes so cars can stop on the right one without blocking the traffic but it's not very safe.
Good spot. We (3 persons) got a ride in 15 min.
Good place. Hitched on a Tuesday morning. Somebody picked us up on their way to work in Copenhagen.
Good spot with place for cars to spot. Lots of people going to Kopenhagen

Went there at 16:00 on a Saturday, the traffic was decent, we got picked up by a taxi driver who was going to the airport to pick up somebody, that's also where we were dropped off. According to him, the spot isn't great, at this time of the day the only people headed towards Copenhagen are Danish people whose car is practically full.
Perfect spot. Hitched from this spot around 12 on a Sunday. Quite some traffic, got picked up in 10 minutes by Swedes who go to Copenhagen for a day trip.
very bad but may be because of it being late.

This spot is pretty good. I got dropped off in the northern part of Norrköping, at a gas station around Östra Eneby, where I didnt get a ride and there wasn't a lot of traffic. A local recommended this spot to me, so I walked about 9km since I had the time anyway, and it was worth it, I got a ride asking people at the rest place behind the McDonalds after like 10 minutes, this was at 15:30 on a Friday.

HOW TO GO SOUTH ?
As most of the people go North.

I sir in front of the gasstation on the rocky pillars. There you can see the car comming from the right and then comming to you for gas. If there have place, i Ask for a ride, and i was sure there where going south, because thé one going North arrive in the gasstation straight and not by thé right).

Great place to ask people directly but thumbing at the exit with a sign saying "NORTH" also worked for me. Got a ride to Sillekrog at 9pm despite the low traffic. If you're not stopping at Stockholm, I think it might be better taking rides to Sillekrog and trying to continue past Stockholm from there rather than go in to the city itself and try from there. Not sure though.
Was standing by the onramp, got a long ride twice. Cars drive very slow since they need to cross the road, hence you got lots of time to wave at them.
Long wait because Swedes dont pick you up, but eventually we got a ride  with a danish guy all the way to Stockholm. He was going to a horse race so we joined him and got beer and wine too!
Petrol station Östgötaporten on the exit of Ödeshög/road 50. Good chances for a ride further in direction Stockholm.
Pretty lonely but also visible. Don’t get caught out here in inclement weather or season.
Hitched from here to Duved (short distance West) twice and didn't wait more than 5-10 minutes, in the dark, in December.
A Norwegian truck stopped going to Rjukan!

i think i just got unlucky - i was stuck here for almost 2 hours when in theory it should be a perfect spot. eventually i was saved and hitched a car to Norway. i reccomend a sign, because after a few kms the road splits in two.

One male 40+, with a sign "Oslo", one big and one small backpacks, sunny, 7 in the morning. Going to Oslo.
A very good spot. Enough space even for a lorry to stop. Cars go slowly, coz they are tragic lights. One line each way. Great spot.
I waited only 5 minutes and I got a ride all the way to Oslo centre.
light traffic, good place to stop
I agree, very good spot for south, got a ride within a minute, they are slow and it's very wide here, perfect for cars to stop

I was hitchhiking in the night and guys picked me up at 22:00. They drove me for 30 km. it’s probably one of the best spots on the way to the South and Stockholm. Cars have to slow down in this part of the road so they notice you every time.
Hitchhiked here in August 2025, lots of commuters to Piteå area go here in the evening (but be careful where to get dropped off there)
Hitchhiked there in 2015, it is indeed a very good spot.

Here is a busstation and alot of people that are going south are passing here to the E4 road. it is not hard to get a hitch here because of cars doesn't drive that fast and it alot of space for the car to stop.
Ride to rovitsbro, from locals going further on the coast.  It was ok

Dir Lysekil

Good bus stop just after the roundabout, Heaps of traffic!
Quick ride to Jönköping indeed, slow traffic, nice visibility.

nice place for going north to motorway.
petrol station + slow traffic going out direction jÃ¶nkoping.
A bit of waiting time, but worth it. Someone took us to the airport for free :)
Really good spot to get to Malmö
Really good place towards Malmö. Got a ride in around 1 hour.
Got ride to Kiruna in like 5 minutes.
Pretty good spot. Traffic can be low sometimes I suppose.
Bus stops are your friend in Sweden. This one got me to Stockholm in 10 minutes.

Good spot for direction Stockholm. Two lanes though. There are many possibilities nearby; all roads here have good possibilies for cars to stop. You could even try two roundabouts further, but there they drive litle faster.
Good spot, but I still had to wait for about 2h. Not so many people up here unfortunately. I was offered some rides to other places (I was headed to Göteborg).  A trucker enventually took me.
Good spot, plenty of people with campervans. We asked around and found ride with guys heading directly to Jonkoping.
lovely older couple wanted to take us to Falkenburg: we just started asking and they were willing :)!!!
Takes a while. Mostly local cars. Some campervans.
arrived late, slept on the hillside, found a straight ride to stockholm after 45min of asking the next morning

Fantastic spot. Got a lift immediately, everyone going here is crossing basicly. I could probably have waited for someone who wasn’t going into Copenhagen, which would have saved me some time on my trip to Germany.
This is where I end up trying to get out of malmo. not a too good spot, but okay. Usually imigrants pick me up. Accessible by bus number 7, you can walk here from svagertorp station.
Got a ride to Ljungby very quickly on a Saturday morning by standing on the side of the road with a "Helsingborg" sign, there is plenty of space for cars to pull over.
Me and my friend waited whole day - 7 hours, trying to get to Goteborg. Did not even get short distance rides during the wait. It was probably not because we were 2 - there were many empty cars...
Great place. Was offered a ride to Gothenburg within minutes but needed to go south, which just took me a few more.
very much traffic from centrum and also from the petrol station nearby. good spot to get on e4, because cars see you early and they can stop on the side lane of the ramp to the highway.
after a very short wait i got picked up by a truck driver going to Östersund. I was going west so i got dropped off in Västerås.

Mostly friendly people, especially the truck drivers were very kind. Little traffik that day, took some huge pauses inbetween, tho seems like a good spot easily reachable from Stockholm. Hitchhiked to Avesta, but realised Enköping was a more reasonable intermediate destination. I believe just a guy going to work.
May 2025. I think I got insanely lucky - a lift all the way to Norway with a local guy.

Small petrol station for both directions. 
First car took me to Örebro, where I got stuck.

Mostly local people. But very easy to get a ride to Vesteros (if you go further I don't reccomend you to go straightly to the city. Ask your driver to stop at some petrol station before Vesteros - otherwise you will stuck in there).
A lot of traffic! Took a long time until someone stopped, but then we got a ride all the way to Skaftö Island.
Many cars going north, it took us abour 20 minutes to get a ride. Unfortunately just quite close.

Me and a friend (guy and girl) took the bus from the STIGS center here trying to hitch north. Waited for about 30 minutes without a ride. Eventually got on another city bus and rode north (without paying).
I hitchhiked north from here ... though there are probably mainly locals, they can take you at least to one gas station and rest place (also for trucks) near Stenungsund - that was my case :-)

Direction: almost everywhere

There are several bus stops just behind the roundabout so the cars are slow and have a lot of space to stop ...

Talk to the people stopping and going to the restaurant.
There is a shower which is not too expensive, if you need one.
Got picked up by a truck really fast, standing at the exit going south
Late july 2014. Great spot, a lot of trucks passing by, though many stay here overnight. Found a ride with a truck going south to Linköping within 45 min.

Mid-October 2013. 1 hour walk from Nykopping. Rest area seemed to be promissing. First I stood at the exit so that it would be possible to catch all cars - from gas station and restaurant visitors. People simply pretended not to see me. There was only 1 truck...and it had to rest till next morning. Running between the cars asking people for any possible ride towards south - hopeless. Asked "7-eleven" shop assisnants - they said that sometimes people don't catch a car the whole day...Optimistic,

rest area with gasstation and foodplaces close to nyköping, called nyköpings bro. Its easy to hitch in both directions. south and north. Good place to be dropped on if you want to find a new ride, not the best starting place from nyköping beacaus its like 1 hours walk to this spot.
Good spot to go to Götenborg, but not so good to go further. Not a lot of cars passing by, but several cars stopped until a guy eventually proposed to take us past Götenborg.
2persons. We were aiming to go towards Norway. Everyone seemed to be only going to Gothenburg, eventually we found a girl that was going to Trollhättan and we decided to get dropped off in Bohus.
many traffic going north, met a helpful person who's going to Göteborg dropped me off the highway further since he knew I was planning to go Oslo
Most people going to Gothenburg. A Polish truck took me all the way to Oslo.

Going for direction north
early August 2023, Saturday midday 1300
1 offer to Mölndal, lots of people going to Gothenburg
30min for ride to Ås. 
One Turkish gentleman insisted on buying me a bus ticket to Oslo, I had to persuade him that I would be fine

We stood up by the pedestrian crossing, so people had good time to see us before having to stop. Skinny road and people slow down, so you can see each other well. Got a ride with some people heading to a "fruit party" 😊 Only one seat available, so one of us got to go in the back. Good vibes.

Tried hitching here with a friend (we were a guy and a girl). Dropped off around noon on a Tuesday. Trying to get to Gothenberg. We held multiple different signs but could not get a ride after waiting almost 2 hours. We finally went to the nearby Burger King to use wifi and went to a spot north of the city. We rode the bus for free to get to the other spot which was MUCH better than here.

Lots of Space for the cars to pull over after the rafic lights. Unfortunately, we met with very immature reactions of the drivers, 3 times they were stopping and driving away as soon as we started walking towads the car until one of te prankers came back and gave us a ride to the last exit before Denmak, a much better spot.
Rush hours works great for me here.
At 21.00 in the evening in November it took me 1,5 hours to get to CPH. I'm sure it would be much faster if earlier and light. There is an ok side lane for cars to stop.
friendly people, patience is worth it
Waited about 20 mins before getting a ride to Hudiksvall.

Trying to get 'north'. Took about one hour. Finally a truckdriver was willing to take us. He only had one seat - but a lot of extra space - so we both fitted. Got a ride until the end of his working day aka Härnösand.

Late in the evening got a ride from a driver speaking just Swedish and only later we figured out he was turning in a few km later. We walked back to the station, but with no more success in hitching, so we camped in the nearby woods. The following day we got a direct ride to Umea.
Hitched north from here in October 2013, asked a couple of people filling their tanks and within 20 minutes had a ride to Sundsvall!
I think here the best option is to ask people at the petrol station. I found a car in 20 minutes to Malmö.

Make a sign and hold it up! It is important to write "Kungsbacka" on it, as well as your final destination. As described in the other review's description - there is a great resting place along the highway a few miles before Kungsbacka that you wanna go to. The name is "Rastplats Sandsjöbacka väster" just so you know. But "Kungsbacka" is better on a sign since more people are familiar with that. Got a ride in ten minutes at noon a sunny day in november. Cars can stop easily, the road is definite

Not the best spot! The cars are driving very fast here because they're the highway. And that place where cars is supposed to be able to pull in, isn't very good - though it is possible. I ended up giving it up after 2 hours
A very good spot for hitching to South. Got a ride in 10 mins. ThereÂ´s a big drive in for the cars to pull into.
I agree, most likely the best place in Gothenburg for south-going traffic. DonÂ´t turn down any short hitches to Kungsbacka, since thereÂ´s an excellent resting place/gas station on the way.

Ride to Harnosand in 10minute. Good spot

Solo male thuesday morning

As previously noted, not amazing but probably the best spot to go south. We asked around at the gas station for a little while with little success. Many people were just staying in the area or even going north. Eventually it's while standing by the roundabout that a car stopped for us, they were going straight to Stockholm.
It's. .. ok. People get slow because if the roundabound. Probably best place to go south. You can go at the gasstation if you want to try another way
Alright spot. Got a ride couple km down. Got by bus from Gothenburg
I came here by bus from Gothenborg. It was raining and I asked around at the gas station. I found a german car that took me all the way to Trelleborg and also on the ferry to Rostock.
Not overly busy, but easy to reach from Gothenburg. Some people going south. Everybody able to leave you at the next gas station ~10 km south is helping.
Gas station. While most cars go back to Gothenburg, this is still the best spot to talk to cars going south.
Asked coming cars to get more south. The trucks weren’t going south, we’re staying to rest, or not willing to take me with them. Was there in the afternoon around 4 pm

I spent a night there, a good camping place right in front of the gas station. Many trucks take rest there, you should talk to truck drivers. It was not much traffic on early morning, but after a couple of hours I got a ride to Copenhagen.
Rest area directly attached to the motorway for cars going both ways. Much traffic.
Not much cars, 'cause here it's mostly norvegians going back after shopping, but it sure is the place to hitchhack south after visiting the rock carvings
First car stopped before we even put our backpacks down. Good spot and a shopping mal and service station nearby.
Not very fun, but it worked. A swedish man picked me up!!
Waited quite a while in the hot sun with a sign. Good place to stop, but not always easy to hitch in Sweden. Finally got a ride with a guy who took me quite a bit towards the northwest. Male/summer

The biggest "Rastplats" I have seen in Sweden so far. Only on one side. but all traffic goes in there. It has also a shop, and a restaurant and a nature patz plus the lake to have your picknick at. Don't swim, its very dirty. All is practically a single huge parking lot. Huge, but spread out very much. No villages around, so that is the only chance to stop. Many cars going south, fewer north. But i managed to get to Sundvall there within 30mins.
mostly local traffic. found a ride to Kristinehamn

Not the best place to wait, but it can do if you are around (the round about just before is ok to hitchhike but not too many cars going by). So you can walk a bit further to the highway, just before the entrance there is space for cars to stop if the traffic is not to heavy, and you will get more cars going by.
Good spot, but have to ask a lot of people, possible to get a ride to Göteborg
Decent, good sleeping possibilities in case you don't find a ride on time. Not much traffic though.

Direction north to Oslo
Early August, Saturday morning. 1030 Snapparp 30min for ride to Gothenburg. There are locals, Norwegian numberplates also. Medium, good frequency of new arrivals. Sign said "Norr på E6". 
But I walked around and approached people.
Decent. Definitely use a sign

Great Spot, but didn't work for me. Stood there an hour from 5 to 6 pm on a Monday in August. Many cars passing by, busstop great for cars to pull into. Had a sign E6 South. 
Male, alone
It’s a nice spot right between a traffic circle and the road to the highway. There is a bus stop so cars can easily pull over. A nice trucker took me to Malmö.
Very little traffic in the evening during march, but got picked up reasonably fast anyway
5 minute wait in the winter.  Might actually be easier in winter since roads were icy so cars had to drive a bit slower and had time to see you and your sign.

It was a narrow country road where buses don't go. I had a banner with a place where farmers stop. Well, Sweden and I think all of Scandinavia is a very bad place to hitchhike. On a major highway you can stand there for 24 hours and everyone will pass by. They will wave at you if that makes you feel better. I hate Scandinavia.
There is enough pace for the cars to stop on the ramp on the way to Göteborg. I waited there for something like half an hour on Saturday morning.
Not many cars, especially in the evening… But keep on trying, it is a good spot!

Direction Norway: Good visibility and much space to stop (bus stop). Not too much traffic, still got a ride after 30min. Many cars are tourist tours or tourists moving short distances. You can warm up, charge and use toilets in the Tourist Station next to it.
Very little traffic, but the spot by itself is really nice as it's just after a road constrictor on the crossroad (so cars are nicely slowing down).
Spend about an hour here. Lots if smiles and waves. One person stopped, but we didn't catch it because they didn't go quite as far as we'd like.
wait infront of the busstation. good spot in direction stockholm. a lot of people take that way for work in norrköping and stockholm.
I got a ride after I asked around forever. Despite there are really a lot of people no one wanted to take me. It needs time to get a ride in skandinavia.
Was dropped at the petrol station. First Campervan I asked said yes. They took me almost to Gothenburg.
Asked the drivers that left the gas station and got a ride to Hammarstrand (which is somewhere in nowhere and was mainly ok since I don't have a clear goal)

Hitched west to Östersund from here in Oct 2013, asked people at this Shell for 15 mins and then found a ride, but in the meantime was offered a ride to Stockholm! Don't bother with the service stations east of here around Bultgatan, seemed to be only locals.
bus stop on the E18 towards Göteborg and Oslo. I was going towards Oslo and my ride was going southwest so i asked to be dropped off in Grums, thats the last town before the roads Split.

One male 40+, with a sign "Oslo", one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Oslo.
A bus stop, good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. 
I waited 45 minutes. I got a short ride to Karstad.
The spot is great but hard to find a lift.
one of the few rest stops in sweden. dont understand why they dont have any. rest stops are always good

Very good spot towards Stockholm. Got a ride from a first guy I asked on a Sunday morning 2.7.2023. there is also a small chapel that is open the whole night, good to sleep in, especially if it's raining.
Bus stop and plenty of space behind it for vehicles and trucks to stop. Lots of drivers were stopping but not going very far, if you wait you are bound to run into someone going far.
I went in the same spot in the same day, this Time (18pm) i had a car in 2 min to udevalla.
Good condition. Place to stop, 13pm, sunny. But i still wait 30 minutes.
The best way to get from Malung, in my opinion. A guy offered to take me to the motel in Duch Mountain, which was a mistake; it took me a few hours to get there.
I don't think this is a good spot, but guy picked me up and brought me to better one.

Ride direction to Orebro. Good spot to stop if your previous ride go in Norkoping and you want to go on the E18 for Oslo, Goteborg or Cph. In an early sunday morning, slow traffic but decent enough, half of the car go straight in town, other half go on the highway.
Car are a bit fast. But decent rate and good visibilty. Git a ride to the next town in 10"
Just a bus stop, good as any of this kind of spots. I would go further but actually my driver saw that he left his laptop in a hotel all the way in Kiruna... Great ride tho.
At this place I was lucky you can say, but in general expect 1-2h waiting times at least on this road. But people and nature are amazing.
Me and my friend (2m) caught a ride far north from here. Many trucks passing by. Ideal for following the E4 direction Stockholm.
Pretty good spot for going North, if a bit fast going-by for my liking

I gave up and took the train to Sundsvall because it was getting dark, but I can recognise that the gas station here is fantastic on paper for going to Sundsvall. Give it a go and make your own report.

Good location to catch southbound traffic, but not great for waiting as it is the entrance of the highway. It's still easy for cars to stop but I wasn't very comfortable with the location. A couple people stopped for us but we're not going very far. We had a sign that said "south", but when we changed it to "Stockholm", someone stopped immediately and could take us most of the way there.

There's a bus stop here. It's technically a good spot with visibility and a place for people to stop. The best spot to go in that direction really, but we still waited quite some time. We are two women.

Took me 2 min to find a ride to Goteborg, by the ferry, it's maybe the best spot to hitchhack out of the city, otherwise you have at least 20 more minutes to walk
I stopped before Goteborg though
Not bad. Cars can drive a bit fast but they can see you from far. We were lucky and got picked up quickly but it's hard to say if that would be common. We were two women.
Only local traffic, but after an hour got a ride through to Umeå
There is place to stop on the side of the road. Not a lot of traffic, but flow and just to Näsåker should be easy.
Gas station. Sign direction Sollefteå. Not a lot of traffic, more going to Ostersund, but got a ride fast.

I wanted to get on the 86, so from Sundsvall I had a sign for Bergsåker to get here and get the better directed traffic. Worked well, just took a while. From here sign Bispgarden, got a ride all the way.
Bus stop, place to stop, many people going towards Gävle. Probably better if you use a sign.
Chill. Nice lawn to sit and eat food from the small store hehe. Solo female. Good bus stop. They go slow.
Chill. Solo female. Slow drivers, bus stop. Short rides.
Prepare yourself for easy but short rides on the 50/68. Good visibility, bus stop with enough space, cars slower after red light.
There's a bus stop for cars to pull over but no shelter. The sparse traffic is going fast
Wanted to hit hitchhike to a place 9km from here. People leaving here talked to us and offered to drive us.
Walked here from Holby to hitchhike to Hedekas. Some traffic.

Decent spot to head north towards Karlstad. You can get here by bus, and there is an old bus stop with plenty of space for cars to stop. There is a light crossing so cars are sometimes going slower. Local told me the place was a little bit dangerous late in the evening.
Instant ride to Orust.
came here late in the evening, spent the night nearby and started asking people in the morning. for two girls with huge backpacks it didnt take long to find someone going north

Ok spot. Very few car, but in countryside the rate ton wish car stop is waaaay better. So we wait 25min (Monday, noon), we hope to Karlstad, dut find to Forshaga. 
On those kind of road, go to bus stop, in general the best place.
July 2025, 10 a.m. , long ride with a nice guy from Stockholm
Classic gastation. Instant car to mellerud. But probably you can be a bit more picky and wait for a further ride.
We waited 45 minutes for a ride, a guy offered to drop us off not in Goteborg but 15 minutes before it so we agreed :) (couple)
Made it here by bus, had a sign, a superb guy picked me up going to work.
Summer 2025, 20:40, I walked and a nice man with his daughter in an old car stopped and picked me up :)
Summer 2025, 8:30
Summer 2025, 12:30, cars stopped every 20 min, but wrong directions
Depends on luck， local people don't stop, waited until a man from Iraq who was on his way to work picked me up!! :)
Seems like a very promosing spot for traffik north, similar situation to the one in Enköping.

Asked around at a gas station little more south, only to realise there is a lot more local traffik there than this spot, probably. Man came to me, old hitchhiker, took me to the highway as he thought that'd be a good spot. Seems like a decent gas station, but Örebro definitely seems like a tricky place to get out of.

Spent quite some time on the busstops before that, wasn't very actively asking around this rather quite gas station. Decent option from Uppsala to Västerås, with some truck drivers. Most traffik seemed to go north or towards Uppsala though. Guy who took me visited a friend and went back home with a small break here – legend for taking me ❤️

We camped in the forest nearby, so it made sense for us to hitchhike from here. There is probably a better option somewhere outside of Lysekil before the roads split. Anyways, we quickly got a ride by some Germans to a roundabout up north.
Good spot to get to the highway

One male 40+, with a sign "Oslo", one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Oslo.
A bus stop, good visibility and enough space even for a lorry to stop. Not very busy road, a few cars per minut.
I waited only 20-30 minutes. The fact that I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem helped me loooads. A Polish guy who passed me already, turned to talk to me, only coz he saw I was Polish. Initially he was supposed to take me to Sodertalje (about 25 kms), but in the end he

Not sure how the staff act in 2025 but since there was a lot of truckers didn't need to as I found a ride south within 30 minutes, a lot of trucks go all the way to Helsingborg here, you can also try the ramp but people seemed to speed there since most traffic came from Mantorp
Pretty good spot for going south, lots of cars and wide shoulder, probably around here the best spot, wait times of 20-50 minutes i'd expect

There's a small bus stop here, locals recommended this spot and said it works well for going south, I got here too late as past 10pm there's basically no traffic and next day already started more south but I'd give it a go if you are in Katrineholm
Very nice countryside road with friendly people, the only problem is that there isn't that many cars here, but you'll get a ride to Alberga within 20 or so minutes
Seems uncomfy for drivers but got a ride towards south within 20 minutes, got some good reactions from drivers as well, seems like the only right spot if headed south from Hudiksvall

For direction south this is a very good lorry drivers spot if you get here early in the morning, truckers recommend this spot, since there isn't any big service stations etc around here, they use this lot for sleeping, but beware if you dont make it here early morning you might not have any lorries here, you can also ask at evening and arrange something for the next day, either way pretty nice alternative spot
This entrance isn't used that much but got a ride within 20 minutes, mainly locals going towards Hörnefors, slow speeds, wide shoulder

Towards south, good spot, very good visibility from highway, and the local road drivers go slow that turn from the port, got a car within couple minutes -probably more likely of 20 minutes wait times, decent place to pull over even at winter, and by now all the local cars are gone, so most likely will get a ride to Skelleftea the least

The road is wide and well plowed during winter, better than staying in Kalix if headed towards Lulea, got a ride within 15 minutes, be aware that the bus stop a bit further up is hidden and people wont have enough time to react so no point walking further along the road from here, ( also turns into 2 lanes after the bus stop)
Good spot at the bus stop but may take a while. I was going to Malmö and eventually got a ride.
very good and nice guy. many cars
Minimum space to stop.
Nice spot to wave on passing cars
Has space to pull over, good visibility, and low speed. For unknown 2 cars stopped but going not towards Gothenburg. Took the 2nd one to the on-ramp and hitchhiked from there.
in front of the pizza place is a large parking space. easy to go to örvik
Not super easy for cars to stop since it’s a big intersection but possible further down a little bit. Going south

August Southbound 
Waited directly on the ramp which ment all the cars had to pass me which was ideal.
Not the safest spot because it's on the ramp and not too much space to stop, but the afternoon traffic (5.30PM) made the cars slow which was great.

August, Southbound 
Bus dropped me off, quite some traffic from all directions. Cars are relatively slow. Similar to Danish ramps with a perfect busstop

Got a ride here after standing next to the highway for an hour. Just look for Norwegian licenseplates at the gasstation and McDonalds. I even asked everyone inside McDonalds because I saw 2 emtpy norwegian cars outside and was desperate ahaha. Happy to get out of Kungälv

Thumbing traffic exiting the gas station. Reasonable amount of traffic. Nowhere to pull over but that’s ok. German camper van stopped, going all the way to Stockholm!! English speaking driver. Solo male.

Bus stop next to T junction, at the moment there were construction signs on the road so cars were going slow and I got picked up immediately.

The bus from Västervik to Kalmar stops here every 2 hours.
Direction Abisco: Rest area with two free cabins and toilets, fireplaces next to a river. Hitching on the main road works good. Space to stop for cars next to the main road .

Got a ride towards Abisko in the winter in the dark with low traffic in about 10 min. I always use that spot because here the local road and the E10 are joining (all traffic direction Narvik passes here).
Got a ride to Kiruna almost instant. Good in winter, might be more difficult with more traffic.
Was easy here in winter (15min).
Good visibility and plenty of space for cars to stop. Got a ride in winter in 15min.
Decent traffic, easy to stop.Works in winter.
Small parking. It was great at is was right after a construction site so cars were slow. Might be not as good when the cars drive with normal speed. Got a ride to Skellefteå in 15min.
There's a fair amount of traffic and little space to stop, but considering the bad rap Sweden gets, this isn't too bad at all.
Was starting to think about wildcamping nearby when after 44min I got my ride all the way to Bodö.
Little bus shelter. Plenty space to stop. Little traffic.

I first tried at the intersection E4/E95, then walked to this spot. A disused busstop. 
After Skelleftea any spot is probably as good as any other.There wont be much traffic anywhere, and anyone will be able to stop anywhere, but most people wont... 

I made it to Bodö in 1 day.
There's a lot of space and better traffic, caught a short ride there. Seems like a good way out of Flen
It's quite a good spot and no other alternatives. I was really lucky and a second car passing stopped there.

Very chill rest-area. Good if your previous lift stop in sundsvall ans you want to find another lift to go further south. (North could work on the other side).
Few trucs and car. No gasstation. Nice picnic table... Not that many people. I just ask everyone comming by :)
Nice gas station. Trucs and cars.

THREE SOLUTIONS:
1. Go at the entrance  of the highway and do classic hitchike
2 wait at the gasstation and ask everyone for lift. But there is not a lot of people.
3 go to the bus stop on the E4.  Nice long area for cars to stop but they ride very fast.
--> my solution: wait for a cars at the entrance 
of the highway. If a car leave the E4 from the opposite direction to go straight to the gasstation walk to them while they filling their cars, then ask for a ride, you have good chance that
Classic gasstation. Half of the car go North, other go south. Easy way is to go ask people.

Very long and wide area. Cars are fast but they have lot of time to see you and slow down.
I was lucky.

Not so Bad !  2 cars in 10 minutes (1pm)
Bus stop where people see your from far and goes on the Goteborg ring.
Not many cars, but good place to rest if you arrive here in the evening. I got a ride here to Odenshog. But should be plenty of traffic toward Jonkoping.

Didn't try here but if you want to get to Rovaniemi / Oulu / Kemi / Tornio from Haparanda and don't feel like walking across the border and like asking people directly, asking at the biggest snus stores should work as long as they have free space in their cars. Snusgrossen probably the most popular store but also King of Snus or even Ikea & Candy World should work.
It took me just a few minutes to find a Polish truck heading to the island of Fyn in Denmark. This spot is nice, and there are plenty of cars here.
Great spot, there is a lot of cars going to Denmark. I got a polish truck going all the way to the Fyn island, which was good spot as well.

Many reviews saying that it should be really easy to get to Denmark. Surprisingly we didn't meet a lot of Danish cars there. After 30mins of asking around we met a guy going all the way to Netherlands. (He had a really small car though).

August, sunday afternoon. Very busy spot. If you are looking for a ride to Copenhagen, than it should be super easy to get one. Sooo many DK cars. Gas station´s staff says that Danish people are comming there to buy cheap cigarets.  This place is too confusing for me. Several restaurant, gas station, too many possible directions. I appreciate well designed toilets at Shell gas station where you can take a quite good ,,shower" in the sink :P.  I was heading south so I moved to on ramp.
Waited outside the subway with a sign and got picked up much quicker, after failing for an hour nearby.
much space, but very little traffic on a Monday morning

Wasn't even asking around, older man just stopped as he noticed my flag and hitchhiked before. I kept my options – Umeå, Västerås and Uppsala – open, but couldn't reject this offer with my nearly dead battery and a place to stay in Uppsala too. Man used to be a hitchhiker, so he knew what it meant.

Got here late in the night. A lady denied me a ride but offered 20euros instead :D I denied them went to sleep in nearby forest. Morning I was asking around for about an hour. Quite many locals. Than moved to thumb on the on ramp. After 10min i got a ride to STHLM.

Perhaps bad timimg because not many cars were stopping in the morning. Safe spot amd slow cars though. When we changed "Solna" to "Upsala" we got a ride in 20 minutes. You can cross the bridge from the central Gävle side (local bus 2 & 4 to Höjersdal bus stop)

We were there before the sunset (August 2014). From the gas station it´s also possible to take another road leading to the city, besides the highway entrance. Lot of traffic was local but eventually we were offered a ride to Uppsala.
Very good place for cars to stop but few do, good way to get out on the highway, I asked for exit 177 to continue north from there

This time there was a construction site along the road where the indicated spot is, so we moved ca. 100m towards Sveaplan and stood in between the traffic lights. A lot of traffic, and well visible spot, but people need to decide fast. We were in the middle of morning traffic but had to wait quite long to get lucky.
Perfect spot, 40 minutes and got a side to Sundsvalle

2023 update. 
Nice place. People stop mostly in the suburb of Stokholm going North. Met 2 nice other Hitchhyker.
Great spot for heading north. Got a ride all the way to Sundsvall with a sign just saying "North". Probably got a bit lucky.

A guy and a girl without a sign on a Friday evening. Don't know about the other spots in the area, but this spot is really dangerous, try not to end up here if possible ! There is clearly no place for cars to stop and cars go too fast.
We hitchhiked a bit down the road on an inserting lane and a guy took us to Håby, the next gas station, but we definitely apologised to him for making him stop there...
got a short ride to the next gas station/rest area. There is much traffic to Norway there.

Is it really that a good spot ? Not sure 

First it's hard to access. You're to cross a fast lane, not a highway but almost. Then walk between spiky bushes to end up on a 2m fence. You can go left around it, and then you are in the spot, in front of a 110km/h sign. 

They dont have an actual seperate place to park, just one lane that is reducing qo they can slow down there. 
I got a ride in 5" to Haby, next gae station.
Great spot with tons of cars. Got picked up straight to Oslo

Much space to pull over, the cars going not too fast, got a short ride 5 km to the next gas station.
If you got a ride to Uddevalla/Torp/shopping mall, choose this ramp. There is one more ramp 900 meters to north, but that ramp is not convenient on evenings because of much much less traffic. 
But this spot is perfect if you're heading north.
Very decent spot, got a traffic light and a pedestrian crosswalk so cars are forced to go slow.
The waiting time ranged from 10 to 60 minutes. I was hitchhiking to Oslo and received two offers to Kungälv; the second time, I accepted the offer.
Not many cars, we wanted to go to Oslo but no one stopped, we eventually took the bus to oslo, wouldnt recommend
We were hyped about the spot because of many positive reviews, but the experience was tragic. We waited 3h 20min with Oslo sign. At 19:50 a guy gave us a 10 min ride to a small village.
Heading to Oslo. Took a while (travelling two people with backpacks) but got picked up and dropped off in Strömstad.
Not a great spot in the dark, I moved to the roundebound so people can see me and cars go fast. The roundebound is better. I think I was quite lucky
Great place for us, got a rid in 10 mins all the way south to Gävle. We might have gotten lucky but the place is really good with plenty of cars driving slowly. We had a sign saying "south"
I was lucky to get a ride further to E4 south. it's not the best spot but it may work - it's between 2 roundabounds so cars drive slow.
We were lucky.

+ good visibility
+ enough space to stop
- no one stops
- teenagers are fucking around with you
- neoliberal capitalist hellhole

Autumn/ Dir South
Lots of traffic going all over the place, use a sign! Good bus stop where cars can pull over.
Finding a ride here was no problem but it took awhile and didn't really get me far. Ended up with a friendly guy who took me to Sundsvall.
Stood at the busstop in front of the gas station.
Waited 15 minutes about on a thursday midday, then got a ride south to Sundsvall from a cool painter that loved Sundsvall.

On the morning of a workday, this was a good spot to head southwards to Sundsvall or Uppsala. 

Waiting time: 15-? min.

I walked 200m from this point, to a bus stop, if you like asking right at the red light you can stay there but otherwise i would suggest the bus stop
There it is easy to find a ride to uddevalla, but not further, night was falling so i gave up and took a lift to uddevalla
People who stopped said swedish were strange but i'm confident about hitchhacking in this country
After 1min a Securitas guy stopped, said that he can't take me in this work car but that i should call a taxi x)
Hard spot to access. And only work people bcus not to mush people go to right to udevalla, so they can stop. We had a ride to Bralanda in 20min
Probably just lucky, but first car took me across Uddevalla
Stay at the bus station Infront of the red lights, good spot, tried the other ones, but the cars went to fast or not the right direction. I drove to Malmö, I used a sign E6 South.
Second time on this spot we gave up after almost 1 hour
We were hitchhiking on a bus stop and got a lift in less than 5 minutes to Malmö.
Sparse traffic in the evening and shelters don't have side walls so they're bad for rainy nights. Got a ride to the town center after asking around
Good place to go to Lulea. There is car parking place and toilets. And good place to camp as well.
Petrol station is getting renovated so less long distance traffic if any
(Winter Direction E4 South) great spot, lots of cars converging into the E4 in the desired direction, it took us about 15 minutes to get a ride.
not that far. could have gotten way better lift if i waited. i recommend standing after the roundabout, theres alot of space for cars pulling in and before they are at top speed.
not that far. could have gotten way better lift if i waited. i recommend standing after the roundabout, theres alot of space for cars pulling in and before they are at top speed.
Lots of traffic here in August, got a ride to Norway before even really starting to look for it.

Been here two times! Once going north to Gothenburg. That was in the summer of 2011 and I got a ride all the way after about an hour of asking people at both Preem and McDonald's. Just no luck. 
   The second time was at about 1 or 2 pm on a sunny day in november. This time I was going south. Asked a few trucks but they were heading north, and most of the other cars as well. Got a ride after an hour to Halmstad! 
   
I am not sure if there's a better spot - but a truck-driver recommended Rastpla
Preem, McDonald's and Max. You can choose to have a sign and stand at the a exit or to ask people at one of the places.
It's ok... The problème is almost everyone is going straight on the bridge and not right on the highway. So it's better to get closer to the highway entrance but then no more place for cars to stop.

Go to the bus stop "Karolinen" Bus 1, 4, 6 go there or just walk from the centre. The next right turn is for Stockholm. I tried and only waited a couple of minutes unil somebody gave me a lift to the next gas station along the highway. Spot is easily accesible and visibility is good
Bus stop on the E22 and slow cars because of the roundabout. Nice spot!
Ride to Varnamo in 5min. The rampe is not the safest, but it's wide enough.

found a ride straight to malmo where i intended to go, took a bit longer maybe harder for brown colored guys to hitch in these part of the world. eventually a moroccan woman stopped and took me all the way, the arabic radio on the way was top on, hahah ;-))

For me it works better at on ramps. Got a ride in about 30min. It was already dark, low traffic, saturday evening. If you like you can ask at nearby rest area. This one is big. Manny option for drivers where to eat and too many directions to go, locals comming for fastfood dinner.
Maybe I was lucky but i waited for maybe 1 minute and this guy pulled up and I got a ride southbound. All the way to! First car that passed.
Highway onramp. Maybe it's illegal to stand here, but it worked.
enough space to park the car and a lot of traffic.
On friday evening I only got local traffic, after an hour I dropped the sign and took a ride to a gas station a little further south.
10 min to go norkoping. SUNDAY. Not a lot of carte pathing by there tho.
Got a ride to Norrköping before we even stopped and finished writing the sign. Seemed to be a nice on ramp with medium traffic.
Always works! Less than 10min and off I am down to the South!
Very nice spot but most Swedish people just don’t pick you up. Eventually we got a ride with a nice guy who offered a ride all the way to Stockholm! Got off in ödeshög though

Technically this should be a great spot (low pavement, mich traffic, Space for cars to pull up), but many ignored us so it took quite a bit to get a ride. 
Most cars are going to Engelholm, with a bit of luck to Halmstad, so I guess Gothenburg is a bit too ambitious from this spot

I completely disagree, this is the best spot in the city! Beyond the bus stop there is a massive hard shoulder where cars with loads of space to safely pull over, I got a ride in three mins north. If you want to go far be willing to reject short rides though as the junctions are almost never as good as this further up. Driver spoke English. Solo male.
Asked around, some traffic going E4.
seems good.
There’s a gas station where you can get car rides with luck. On ramp to motorway there isn’t any places for cars to stop so this better place. For truck rides you have to go other side of motorway.
the driver who took me said there were not many cars going to the South from this spot, and took me to a gas station on the E4 which was perfect.
Little gas station and on-ramp to south. Average on weekands, maybe good on weekdays.

Ride to enjoping in 10min. 
Early morning, it's better cuz then it's lower traffic on this big road.
Chaotic with multiple lanes, relatively high speed and quite some busses. Annoying spot to deal with, although could be used when traffik is more quiet or at a potentially better time of the day.

There is a busstop (Flogsta Centrum) at the highway, vis a vis Ica väst. From the central station the busses 5 and 22 are going regulary there. Its the best place in Uppsala to hichhike to the west: to Enköping (Road 55) and than conect to E18 and Göteborg. Or if you want to go south and you want to avoid Stkhlm. From there you can also go on road 72 to the north if you want to avoid E4. Its also nice to put up the tent over night: ether north of the bus station in a small forest in Berthaga (5m
A guy and a girl without a sign on a Thursday afternoon. You might have to ask at this spot, hitchhiking cars without a sign didn't work for us. We eventually walked to Lund to find a better spot.
It worked to go about an hour North, have to ask around, got lucky since it was Sunday and summer

Me and a friend got dropped off on the freeway and the cops caught us hitchhiking there (what is illegal) and drove us to here as it is a safer and legal place for hitchhiking. There's a gas station here, and we started to talk to the drivers. Many didn't even open the window to talk to us, many just ignored us as if we were invisible and no one was going (at least it is what the few who answered said) north to Helsinborg. I think this area is a residencial neighborhood, apparently not lots of p
super lucky, a pakistan couple passed by and stopped, they didn't ask me where i was going, and I didn't ask them where they were going :)

Not much space to pull over, but alright. There is much traffic there due to the shopping mall and the gas station. Less traffic on late evenings and holidays. Got a short ride on my way south (not the 1st time at this spot).
Little traffic and not the best spot anyway, but I was lucky and only waited 15 mins.
Lots of traffic and no space to stop for the cars...

A guy and a girl without a sign. We arrived on a Thursday evening and hitchhiked for about an hour without anyone taking us. We slept a bit north in the small village and got a ride to Götenborg in the morning. Not the best spot as cars go quite fast, but there is an emergency lane for cars to stop.

Good spot to go back on the highway to Goteborg. People are slow tanks to the roundabound and the one on the right band are going on your way. Lot of space to stop.
Try to have someone that go AFTER Helsingborg.
Huge sign (1.5x1m) and a car coming back to pick me up ... Traffic is super fast there so you need to be lucky

Both E4 and the ramp have little traffic towards south, so it's advisable to try to catch cars from both, long speeding lane and pretty comfortable place for drivers to stop, but due to traffic density expect 20-40 minutes of wait time
not a lot of traffic, but at least i got a ride to Örebro

One male 40+, with a sign "Oslo", one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Oslo.
Not too good place. Quite little traffic (a car every 2 minutes). Not really a place to stop. But cars go really slowly and there is good visibility.
I waited only 15 minutes. The fact that I was wearing a t-shirt with a big Polish emblem helped me loooads. A Polish couple, who stopped, told me that they had done it only coz they saw that t-shirt.
They were superb nice and took a bit longer w
Just have to wait, because a swedish man was curious about what I was doing, and it was first time for him to pick up people

From the begginig it looks a little bit bad, but There are Danish, German, Nietherlandern going, too and near by is McDonald's. So Yeah, we were lucky to catch two amazing Danish ladies and got a ride straight to Copenhagen. They used to hitchhike too, they were very kind and helpful.
Maybe this roundabound could be to go to Oslo, too.
Crazy spot, I stood inside the "barrier?" for the safety, those who want to stop will stop, just wait! A nice swedish man picked me up because he did hitchhike when he was young too:)
High flow with people going south, though a bit hard to catch people before they started accelerating.
Hitchhiked in the afternoon, July 1 2025, fast cars but good volume, best location around, good for distance north on road E4. Was taken to gävle

The E4 entry is definitely better, but the police sent me away. 

Got a ride from a driver that happened to see my sign ("NORR") from the opposite side. Being between 2 roundabouts he was easily able to turn around.
got an extremely lucky lift with a guy going southwest near värnamo. macdonalds in nyköping is pretty useful when hitchhiking.
too many places to stand in my opinion. definetly too small off ramp to stay there. i got a lift askimg the cars at macdonalds.
In Sweden only foreigners take hitchhikers :))
The spot is not really good. Not that much traffic and a lot of it local.

Reading the negative comments my heart sank when I was dropped here. It's true that there isn't any place to stop, but as the slip road has two lanes people where happy to stop in the road. 6 mins and somebody stopped, only going 20k or so, rejected and 15 mins later another person stopped, even in this crap spot. Seriously, quit the negativity, smile and stop dressing like a drug trafficker, and you will get through :) (solo male)
One of the worst places I've ever been: Many cars are coming by but it takes hours until some stops. No Shadow.
Spot doesn't seem too great as it's about after a curve and cars are rather fast. Still good visibility and plenty of space to stop (bus stop). Got a ride after 20min in the dark in winter.

I try again. In the opposite direction. Way less people (18pm).
Still looks like a good place ... But i dont know why it's si long there.

Very chill gasstation, lake and forest. Lot of people go North And South, mostly to Stokholm.
Still wait almost an hour.
It's..  ok. Go closer to the roundabound people get slower. Or to the gasstation if you wanna try another way

OK spot but still the best on Kiruna for that direction. The guardrail ends about 100 meters from the intersection and then people can stop on the shoulder of the road quite easily. Good visibility and they aren't going too fast yet.
Now in 2025 there is much space to stop at the sides of the road. Cars are still going with reasonable speed
No place to park, going east
Owfull place. No place for cars to stop AT all. But still best place to go in this direction.

i had a ride from mjolby and wanted to head to copenhagen but the driver had to go south sweden so i was dropped here, it took a little longer than expected but a kind truck driver did stop eventually and too my to copenhagen ;-))
Waited over a hour at the gas station  but no luck. I decided to switch places here and almost right away somebody stopped and took me to Copenhagen 👌
August, sunday afternoon. High traffic,  good visibility, plenty of space to pull over. Unsuccessfully tried a sign saying Germany. Than switched to Treleborg and got a ride in 15min. Easy peasy.
ok spot was waiting for about 20 min to get a ride to copenhagen, i got droped of here by a truck that was going down to trelleborg, and it seemed the last option to stay on the road to copenhagen.
Good gas station, right along the highway towards stockholm. A friend and I got a ride to stockholm within 10 minutes. Good circulation of cars
2 friends were hitchhiking from here and got a ride straight up to Stockholm. People were friendly, it's best to ask directly at the gas station.
5 fuckin hours waiting
The only possibility is to try at the petrol station or get the car that moves towards the tiny on-ramp... it failed

Does not have the most space available to stop but its okay. Got the ride at 9 AM on a Sunday.

Last day was waiting here 2h on Saturday at 17.00.
Good spot for cars to stop, quite a bit of traffic due to the shopping center
Decent spot, just not a lot of place for the cars to stop. Good for going up north
The spot right after the roundabout, not much space to pull over, but still alright. Much traffic north to Gøteborg.
Worked well for me, got a ride to Goteborg in some 20 mins. Not much space to pull over, though.
almost no traffic...
Was heading to E4South. Good spot with visibility and place for cars to pull over (a bit over the grass, but well!). Traffic is average. I got picked up by a truck driver up to Gavle.
Pretty nice spot. A car managed to pull over. Not a lot of traffic though.
Not too much space, but a campervan managed to pull over. So I guess it is all right.
Enough space to stop. Nearby service station if you want to ask people but most probably heading north there.
Not so good, but still working. I had to wait an hour to get a ride south. Two other cars stopped too, but they were only driving very locally.
I'd say it's pretty good alternative to the gas station, lights at evening and space on shoulder, got a car within 30 minutes towards south
There's space to stop on the ramp. Though very few cars passing. Better get dropped of at some fuel station earlier. Got a ride 40 k's within 45 min.
Good spot(as well in winter)  and decent traffic. Still had way for about 2 hours
Caught a ride over to Norway from here in about 30-40 min. There is space here for cars to pull over safely. I could not find a better place closer to the city to hitch from.

A guy and a girl withiut a sign on a Friday evening. Very bad spot. There is clearly no place for cars to stop, maybe if you go hitchhike at the redlights nearby, but it's impossible to hitchhike on the ramp.
We were on the other side of the road wondering how to hitchhike here when two really nice girls stopped by to help us thinking we were lost. They ended up taking us to Uddevalla, so we were quite lucky !
