Sorry guys, but this might be my lucky spot! Within 10 minutes I got a short ride to the next gas station/rest area. The driver mentioned it’s not a safe spot since the ramp is already part of the motorway — but in my opinion, it’s still a usable place for hitchhiking north.

Don't know how the previous person did it, but this is a highway entrance, no clue where cars could possibly stop... Stuck in Kungälv for 2.5h now, no good spots to go north. Might try going back to Göteborg and trying from there
Much traffic going north, enough space to pull over, got a ride to Uddevalla.
Low traffic, but eventually got to a ride to gothenburg. We chose to be dropped of here instead of Torp mall.

August, Southbound 
Came here because I was stuck at the Torp mall, but this place isn't better. Ended up going back to the mall

Plenty of Space on the roundabout, not a lot of trafic and the cars can stop easily. Got a ride to central Goteborg. If you by any chance get stuck in te Torp mall 5 km South from here and are going South, it´s wort the effort to come back to this entrance.
Good spot. There’s a bus stop where cars can slow down. I recommend having big sign so cars can see you early enough. Speed limit is 100km/h so many may drive past you before noticing you.
spot is good, but waiting time isn't ;)
Not bad place but you need waittttt sometimes a lot time :)
There s a busstation there, you should stand there with a linkÃ¶pingsign if you go west. I waited for 2 hours approx, but it was late at night.
Spot okay. Not too many cars driving north. Was lucky and a camper stopped. With enough time it's a good spot going north I guess.

We (two guys and a girl) got a lift from here all the way to Narvik, about 2000 km away (the longest lift i have ever had)! We stood right after the roundabout where cars can stop easily. It took us around 15 minutes to get a ride.
Couple. We got here lift from "prime" spot in Malmo. Got a ride to next station in ~20 minutes. Low traffic.
Got dropped off here. A lot of traffic, but nobody going north toward Helsingborg or Gotenborg. Avoid it if possible in favor of service station a few kms north on E6.
Got a ride to Trelleborg very quickly. There is only limited space on the ramp for cars to pull over, but it works. Also people at the gas station can see you and call you over.

Big fuel station. Lots of Danish cars, at least during summer. Write "DK" on sign (seems Danes are more likely to pick you up than Swedes). There's not much place to stop but since there are quite few cars it worked alright.
Good spot, decent visibility and people aren't driving fast.
We had no luck here. Very few cars. We walked all the way to the Abisko touriststation without a ride.
There is a lay-in for cars to stop and the cars are not too fast. But most of the cars are pretty full due to the holiday time.
Good spot to ask for a ride at the rest area around the McDonalds. Hitched a ride there at about 17:00 to Jönköping, took me maybe 5 minutes directly asking people.

Were dropped here from Linköping, going south. Big mistake. Few cars, even fewer who would take us. Almost everyone was local, going to shop dinner at one of the hamburger places. Finally got a ride after maybe 3-4 hours of desperate searches.
I had very good luck here! Got a local driver who took me to Linköping and drove me for the next good spot! Its all about attitude :)
I was so f--king annoying! Only local traffic and truck on the pause.
I was so f--king annoying! Only local traffic.

Looks like a perfect spot. 
Lot of German and Dutch tourist. Mot of van and camping car. Lot of east Europe trucs. So good conditions to go far. 
But i was unlucky. I ask everyone for 1h30 with very bad result. Finally got a ride to the next Big gasstation that's looks even better.

camping in the woods near the lake is very nice, but there was nearly no traffic at the petrol station, so i had to walk down to the highway.. but cars are mostly too fast to stop (and it's illegal to stand there), after a hour i got a ride to jönköping.

we sat at the petrol station,1 car in 20minutes, it was already dark, thinking about a night in the forest (which had been really cold in february) and then a car stopped. he just said "stockholm?" and we were fell into his arms and hugged each other
i've been standing there for 4hours and noone stopped. guess it depends on the time guess it would have been better in summer (i was lifting there in oktober...)

maybe one of the best places I ever tryed out. slow traffic, directly coming from the petrol station and enough place for carstop...

2 minutes until a direct ride to stockholm.
